turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Baghouse.
turn.1: what are the different sections of the baghouse?
turn.2: Pressure drop, filter drag, air-to-cloth ratio, and collection efficiency are essential factors in the design of a baghouse.
turn.3: what are the types of bags used in the baghouse?
turn.4: Fabric filter bags are oval or round tubes, typically long and in diameter, made of woven or felted material.
turn.5: what are the different applications of the baghouse?
turn.6: Depending on chemical and/or moisture content of the gas stream, its temperature, and other conditions, bags may be constructed out of cotton, nylon, polyester, fiberglass or other materials.
turn.8: Nonwoven materials are either felted or membrane.
turn.9: What are the types of membranes used in the bags?
turn.10: Nonwoven materials are attached to a woven backing (scrim).
turn.11: What is the purpose of the scrim?
turn.12: Felted filters contain randomly placed fibers supported by a woven backing material (scrim).
